Posted By: Cyberium (6/26/2010 6:34:10 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Semi-shroud!! This may be even more fun than actual shroud, since it presents your opponents with a very annoying question: should I waste two removal spells on one creature? The obvious answer being yes, since the other creatures are protected also. I'd say you should also play Vines of Vastwood with this card. Your opponent plays one removal spell, countered. The glass shield is down, so you can target Kira now too. Then they play another, and you respond with a Vines of Vastwood, kicked or unkicked. Meh heh heh heh!! And if they have another removal spell so what, they just used three cards to remove ONE creature. Kira, one of the best, most fun card designs ever. 5 outta 5.
posts.html:
Semi-shroud!! This may be even more fun than actual shroud, since it presents your opponents with a very annoying question: should I waste two removal spells on one creature? The obvious answer being yes, since the other creatures are protected also. I'd say you should also play Vines of Vastwood with this card. Your opponent plays one removal spell, countered. The glass shield is down, so you can target Kira now too. Then they play another, and you respond with a Vines of Vastwood, kicked or unkicked. Meh heh heh heh!! And if they have another removal spell so what, they just used three cards to remove ONE creature. Kira, one of the best, most fun card designs ever. 5 outta 5.

Posted By: nevenshinko (6/3/2012 5:28:36 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I was looking to make a mono blue control EDH and after reading up on some creatures, Kira was just way to good to pass up. Yeah, opponents can target me making me sac things (like Diabolic Tutor), but for the most part Kira, keeps your stuff safe, however there is a drawback. The ability will counter anything you try to do to creatures as well.
  
   
Since my deck is somewhat instant/sorcery heavy (what blue deck wouldn't be), I decided to run [Runechanter's Pike](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Runechanter's Pike). The other day I targeted Kira with the Pike, and it gets countered the first time, I equipped it again and it stayed, this however allowed my opponent to tap Kira before my attack phase. That bought him a turn, but it's something I was well aware could happen, and it was worth the risk.
  
   
He was playing a mono white Lin-Sivvi rebel EDH, his lack of flying is what did him in, that and the 4 Frost Titans I managed to doppleganger into play keeping everything tapped.
posts.html:

Yeah, opponents can target me making me sac things (like Diabolic Tutor), but for the most part Kira, keeps your stuff safe, however there is a drawback. The ability will counter anything you try to do to creatures as well.

Since my deck is somewhat instant/sorcery heavy (what blue deck wouldn't be), I decided to run Runechanter's Pike. The other day I targeted Kira with the Pike, and it gets countered the first time, I equipped it again and it stayed, this however allowed my opponent to tap Kira before my attack phase. That bought him a turn, but it's something I was well aware could happen, and it was worth the risk.

He was playing a mono white Lin-Sivvi rebel EDH, his lack of flying is what did him in, that and the 4 Frost Titans I managed to doppleganger into play keeping everything tapped.
